headline: Our Favorite Balsamic Vinaigrette
description: This balsamic vinaigrette with honey, mustard, and garlic is easy to make in a jar in a matter of minutes for a delicious dressing on lots of salads.

video.description: Homemade vinaigrette made in just a few minutes.
video.name: Our Favorite Balsamic Vinaigrette

name: Our Favorite Balsamic Vinaigrette
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, Dijon mustard, shallot, garlic, salt, and black pepper together in a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid.
Replace the lid on the jar and shake vigorously until thoroughly combined.

review.reviewBody: Good & easy

This was great! I subbed some red onion for the shallot because that's what I had on hand, and I added a full tablespoon of honey. I'd recommend tasting first before increasing anything. A sweeter balsamic might not need that much. Will definitely make again!

This has been my GoTo salad dressing since I first tried it. Using all organic items, I know that I'm getting a good quality and a delicious dressing. Another reviewer noted that if you use dehydrated onion and garlic it will last a month in the cupboard. I have this on hand all the time and never had a problem with it lasting. I use it with a simple salad with Spring greens, pecans, blue cheese and a fruit (apple, blueberry's etc...) Love it!
The amount of salt is very important. A lot, about a teaspoon. A few drops lemon juice also.
Added 1/4 tsp of maple syrup instead of honey!! Yummy
This was very easy to make and very delicious! I used it on a berry salad.
Spot on! Have made it twice in a week. GF and her daughter both loved it! Added red pepper flakes for a touch of heat.
I made the recipe verbatim and it tasted beautiful. I noticed the difference from store bought right away! This is my new go to!
I love this dressing, wouldn't change a thing!

Liked it, but did tablespoon of dijon and tablespoon of Chick-fil-A sauce (my family's preference), also subbed dried onion for shallots since I didn't have any. Also added a couple dashes of worcestershire sauce for a savory flavor. It was great after that
This was very good. Regrettably, I didn't have a shallot, so I sub'd some green onions. But it still tasted fantastic!!
Omg, this is amazing! I use really good EVOO and Balsamic. I didn't have shallots so I just used garlic. I've searched the web for delicious dressings and finally found it, thank you!
It was a beautiful vinaigrette. The only change I made was because I didn't have Dijon mustard. I used seeded mustard instead.

I am or have always been a hardcore "Ranch" person. ALWAYS and I'll be honest I have never been a fan of vinaigrette's in general but I needed one so I chose this recipe based on the 5 star rating. I made it exactly as written and now it is hands down my very favorite salad dressing! It really must sit overnight to be able to taste the full flavor but once it has it is tangy, very slightly sweet, semi-thick and OH SO GOOD! I used whatever Balsamic vinegar that I had on hand which was Colavita brand and it worked perfectly. It is a tad bit spicy so that is something to keep in mind, I'm sure it came from the shallot but OMG is it good! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!
I love this! It’s my go-to salad dressing. Heck, it’s so delicious it is DRINKABLE!
This has been my go to recipe for years. I cut the EVOO back to 1/4 c.

I've made this recipe several times with no alterations and like it very much. (I use OMG balsamic vinegar both unflavored and in various fruit flavors such as blood orange, blackberry, and raspberry.)
I salted to taste, but once on my salad, it needed more. I will try a 1/4 tsp next time.

Made exactly as written. Served over a bag of Wegman’s mixed green with a quiche (Chef John’s Quiche Lorraine from this website which, BTW, is one of the best quiche he recipes ever!). Simple and delish. Worthy of company.

I've taken some liberties with this recipie. I use 1/8 cup oil and 3/8 cup balsamic vinegar to cut down on the fat (plus I like it tangier). I found some Bees Knees spicy honey that goes great and I also use Asian mustard to add some kick.
This was easy and excellent !
Easy to make and great tasting !

Made this last night to go with a side salad, it was delicious. A bit sweet, perhaps, but that's how I like it! Read the ingredients, it should be obvious that it will be sweet! I used a good quality balsamic vinegar, that certainly helps! My son had seconds of the salad, quite unusual for him!
This is such an easy and delicious recipe. It was very mild, yet zippy. We used it as a sauce for a brown rice/farro bowls. What an extra special supper!!
Love this recipe!
Absolutely fantastic. Wouldn't change a thing!
excellent idea, I added Parmesan and another tsp of honey. Don't add fresh cracked pepper use ground
I have made this sooo many times, just as it’s written. It’s perfect! Thank you!
By accident I added 1 TBLS of honey (recipe calls for 1tsp). It tuned out great! Will modify recipe for the future:)
Perfect as written. I like the touch of honey to balance out the balsamic vinegar. Easy to make at the last minute and lasts for a few days in the refrigerator.
This is great. I usually don't have a shallot but everyone still loves it anyway. Super simple and takes less than 15 minutes. I also use 1/2 teaspoon of squeeze garlic instead of a clove.
It turned out well despite the fact that I didn't have all the ingredients. I was out of honey so I used agave and I also didn't have scallions. It tasted good anyway.
Fabulous! Love it! Need to try with really good quality vinegar because I am having to add more honey.
I increased the oil a bit to make it less acidic.
Nice dressing and easy to make.
Very nice. Proportions were fine. Made no alterations. Delicious dressing.
I made this salad dressing and used onion powder instead of shallots. I put it in the fridge for a couple days before the dinner party, it was pretty tasty on a green salad!
The only change I made was to add just a little more balsamic vinegar and honey. It's very good!
So much better than store bought!
This is the perfect recipe. Never buying this dressing from the store again.

My son asked me to find him a good balsamic vinaigrette. We tried several on this site, but this one is the winner. I did take one reviewer’s advice and reduced the balsamic vinegar by half (ie. start with 
1/2 c vinegar and reduce to the 1/4 c the recipe calls for) on the stove to intensify the flavor. The result was a rich, intense-tasting vinaigrette that emulsified beautifully. I think my son would drink this if I let him!! Thanks for a wonderful recipe!
I used avocado oil and Swerve zero calorie sweetener and it was great. This will be my go dressing!
I needed to add more oil and let the mixture sit overnight in the fridge so it wasn't too strong. Used top shelf balsamic vinegar and olive oil.
Simple and delicious.

So who’s still buying store bought salad dressing?! YOU SHOULDN’T BE!! I make this for our house whenever we run out!! Tastes great and if you want to change the flavor a little? Don’t add the honey and sub in Worcester Sauce!! Hubby and I were never in to the “white” salad dressings... 

THIS SALAD DRESSING ROCKS!!
Yes, will make it often. Had no Dijon mustard, so used regular and added a little more honey. Delicious!
Loved this! Out of honey so I used some sugar. I agree with the submitter that good balsamic is key. Easy, quick and delicious!

The recipe is flavorful! You can detect the notes of all the ingredients together, but each stands up on its own as well. I love how simple this recipe is. 

I will likely use less shallot next time, but that is a matter of my own personal taste, and does not reflect upon the recipe as is. 

This recipe really is worth all the favourable reviews! If you've been thinking about making your own dressing - especially first-timers like myself, this is the perfect starting place.
It tastes delicious
Love it. I add a little more mustard and garlic. Just a personal thing. I’ve made it many time’s.
Made as is. Salad dressing one night and chicken marinade the next
Excellent! Perfect blend of sweet and vinegar
Goes great on my grilled cheese caprese sandwich
Excellent!
Added dill, used homemade spicy mustard and doubled the shallot.

I really like the salad dressing. It doesn't have a strong flavor but definitely has enough that adds a light, refreshing taste to the salad. Next time I make it, I will add a Tbs of balsamic dressing just to get a hint more balsamic flavor. I will also add an additional clove of garlic. I saw another person's review which said the dressing is more like a honey mustard vinaigrette. I disagree with that review. The honey nor the mustard flavor stand out.
This is the recipe I’ve been looking for to dress my salads. Perfect blend of sweet and tart!
Use a good quality balsamic (3 leaf) and leave out the honey. Also added a pinch of oregano and basil.
I made it exactly to the tee and it was delicious! My husband loves this dressing. I will definitely make this in the future!

I didn't make any changes except lowering the amount of olive oil to 1/4 and I left out the shallot since we didn't have any. This dressing was very good- very sweet, but I enjoyed it. Definitely will make again!
Our go-to vinaigrette recipe, always put it on a homemade version of SweetGreen's Harvest bowl
Excellent. Used it on romaine/spinach salad and it was ideal.
I used a little Swerve instead of honey to make it KETO friendly. I also blended it and it was amazing! Great recipe!
This is my go-to salad dressing. So good!

I add the salt and pepper, to taste, to the salad directly instead of putting them in the dressing. After I emulsify, I often add a little more olive oil and emulsify it because the dressing is very thick. This is our favorite dressing!! You must use a high quality balsamic vinegar.
Just made it to put over pork loin and wow, it is good! I used garlic powder and onion powder, no shallots. Yum.
Great recipe! Instead of salt and minced garlic, I used garlic salt. Also, I eye balled the measurements and it turned out delicious! Thanks!
This is very good I some balsamic vinegar from the Olive Cart in Michigan which is amazing, it was aged for 25 years, so I was looking for a good recipe and this is it!
Very good. Everyone like it.

5 stars as written, hands down!! My family likes a bit more zip so I added black pepper and more garlic and we loved it. I so appreciate recipes that can be catered to individual tastes while starting out amazing as written. Thank you!!

Amazing recipe. I added a dollop of almond butter to give it a creamy texture. Served it over a bed of arugula and baby spinach and goat cheese medaillons. If I had had any I would have added fresh figs as the finishing touch. Mmmmmmm
Awesome! I used a spicy mustard and added more red pepper flakes to give it a little kick. Overall taste is excellent though. Make sure to let the flavors blend for 30 minutes or overnight.
Quick, easy and great flavor.
This was lovely, simple, classic. Alas, the home was without shallots, so I had to excuse their absence from the final production, but, it was very good, a sort of template for all vinaigrettes.
I added a pinch of McCormicks Italian seasoning and yes I will be making it again and again.
I added all the ingredients to my mini food processor and blended everything together so it was a little creamier.

Didn't change a thing except perhaps a titch more honey. Delicious. I will NEVER buy balsamic dressing again. Used fresh greens, red onion, pralined pecans, and blue cheese crumble. FABULOUS! Thank you!
I made half of this recipe and put in minced green onion because I didn’t have a shallot and it was so good. This is a definite keeper!
This came out great and is so much better than a bottles dressing
Wonderful!

Love this recipe, I add a few shakes of Italian seasoning and use the “light taste” olive oil

You can use minced onion instead of shallots also can replace Honey with 1tsp of sugar per 8 servings.

Enjoy! :)

This is really good, per the reviews I used spices vs fresh shallot and garlic. I added some cayenne pepper and used monk fruit extract extract vs honey to keep it as low carb as possible. I never knew mustard was a binding agent between the oil and vinegar. The texture is thick and cream. Perfect recipe!
loved it!
Nice balance of sweet and tangy, although to me the flavor is pretty subtle overall. I used red onion bc that’s what I had, and about double the garlic.
Fast, easy, delicious.

This is a great basic recipe! A hack I have discovered is to use an AeroLatte to emulsify the oil with the other liquids. It is fun to do and totally mixes up the ingredients without separation. It is only good for small batches and does not work with thicker dressings.
Love it!
The original recipe is too oil-based, in my opinion! It tasted more like I was pouring straight-up balsamic-infused olive oil on my salad. Luckily, it was quite easy to modify to my tastes.
Delicious!
So quick, easy and flavorful. I prefer agave nectar to honey though. I will use this recipe frequently.
Follow the recipe exactly. Delicious! Served on arugula and everyone raved.
I made it per the recipe except I didn't have shallots. I thought it was excellent and will definitely make again.

I didn't have the ingredients to make a greek dressing but wanted something to go on my salad with feta cheese. This was an easy recipe I could make with ingredients I had on hand, and I didn't have to pull out my blender. As I had read in one of the reviews, I upped the olive oil and prefer it that way. I swapped regular mustard for the Dijon and thinly sliced red onion for the shallot. I used pink himilayan salt.
SO, SO good. Great balance of sweet and tangy. I crave this on a salad daily now. Easy to make and you are not eating all the preservatives and extra junk that is in store dressings. Very good!!
So simple to make and very basic ingredients everyone should have in their kitchen
I double it, use 1Tbs grated onion instead of shallot & added extra 1tsp honey. Delish!
Great flavor!
This dressing is Delicious. I did add more of the garlic and I used Coleman's powdered mustard because I did not have Dijon mustard on hand. I increased the garlic and mustard by 1/2tbs.
No changes needed! Very delicious
